private_information: I can drive between places; driving takes 10 time units
I cannot be at a place during travel intervals
truck0.goal: Assist in transporting crates as needed to achieve global stacking goals.

private_information: I can drive between places; driving takes 10 time units
I cannot be at a place during travel intervals
truck1.goal: Assist in transporting crates as needed to achieve global stacking goals.

private_information: I stay at my place and can lift/put/load/unload crates with temporal constraints
Lifting lasts 1, putting down lasts 1, loading into truck lasts 3, unloading from truck lasts 4 time units
hoist0.goal: Manipulate crates at my location to support global stacking goals.

private_information: I stay at my place and can lift/put/load/unload crates with temporal constraints
hoist1.goal: Manipulate crates at my location to support global stacking goals.

private_information: I stay at my place and can lift/put/load/unload crates with temporal constraints
hoist2.goal: Manipulate crates at my location to support global stacking goals.

private_information: I stay at my place and can lift/put/load/unload crates with temporal constraints
hoist3.goal: Manipulate crates at my location to support global stacking goals.

private_information: I stay at my place and can lift/put/load/unload crates with temporal constraints
hoist4.goal: Manipulate crates at my location to support global stacking goals.

private_information: I stay at my place and can lift/put/load/unload crates with temporal constraints
hoist5.goal: Manipulate crates at my location to support global stacking goals.

orchestrator.goal: Coordinate trucks and hoists to achieve the target crate-on-surface relations while minimizing total time.

public_information: Trucks move between places and take 10 time units per drive
Hoists stay at places and perform lifts/puts/loads/unloads with specified durations
Crates and pallets form stacks; crates can be on surfaces (pallets or other crates)
Hoists are the only manipulators that can pick up and place crates; trucks can carry crates when loaded by hoists

orchestrator.system_prompt: You are an expert in encoding multi-agent temporal planning problems in PDDL. You will be given complete environment initial state and goal specifications, and constraints/capabilities of trucks and hoists. Produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that models timed driving of trucks and temporally constrained hoist actions (lift, putdown, load, unload). Ensure actions specify start/over all/end conditions and start/end effects consistent with the environment description. Include an objective to minimize total-time.
orchestrator.prompt:
Your name is orchestrator.
Initial information about the environment: {environment->init}.
Goal for the environment: {environment->goal}.
The public information is: {environment->public_information}.
The trucks' constraints are: {agents->agent_details->truck0->private_information} and {agents->agent_details->truck1->private_information}.
The hoists' constraints are: {agents->agent_details->hoist0->private_information}, {agents->agent_details->hoist1->private_information}, {agents->agent_details->hoist2->private_information}, {agents->agent_details->hoist3->private_information}, {agents->agent_details->hoist4->private_information}, {agents->agent_details->hoist5->private_information}.
Think step by step and provide a PDDL domain and problem that encapsulate the integrated temporal model, respecting the constraints of each agent and the given initial state and goals. Do not make assumptions beyond the given information. There is no need for anything else beyond producing the pddl files.
